data.title: The essential Russian movies list
data.meta_description: Few days ago I ran into a list of the essential Soviet Union (and by extension, Russian) movies to watch. I don't think it's an actual top, though the first 10 movies in the list are spot-on. No external links, research and download them on your favorite websites.
data.text:
Few days ago I ran into a list of the essential Soviet Union (and by extension, Russian) movies to watch. I don’t think it’s an actual top, though the first 10 movies in the list are spot-on. No external links, research and download them on your favorite websites.

#1 THE MIRROR

Andrei Tarkovsky, Soviet Union, 1975

#2 MAN WITH A MOVIE CAMERA

Dziga Vertov, Soviet Union, 1929

#3 COME AND SEE

Elem Klimov, Soviet Union, 1985

#4 TALE OF TALES

Yuri Norstein, Soviet Union, 1979

#5 ANDREI RUBLEV

Andrei Tarkovsky, Soviet Union, 1966

#6 STALKER

Andrei Tarkovsky, Soviet Union, 1979

#7 BATTLESHIP POTEMKIN

Sergei Eisenstein, Soviet Union, 1925

#8 THE COLOR OF POMEGRANATES

Sergei Parajanov, Soviet Union, 1969

#9 THE ASCENT

Larisa Shepitko, Soviet Union, 1977

#10 I AM CUBA

Mikhail Kalatozov, Cuba, 1964

#11 THE RETURN

Andrey Zvyagintsev, Russia, 2003

#12 THE WISHING TREE

Tengiz Abuladze, Soviet Union, 1976

#13 STRIKE

Sergei Eisenstein, Soviet Union, 1925

#14 BED AND SOFA

Abram Room, Soviet Union, 1927

#15 EARTH

Aleksandr Dovzhenko, Soviet Union, 1930

#16 HAPPINESS

Aleksandr Medvedkin, Soviet Union, 1935

#17 BY THE BLUEST OF SEAS

Boris Barnet, Soviet Union, 1936

#18 ALEXANDER NEVSKY

Sergei Eisenstein, Soviet Union, 1938

#19 THE CHILDHOOD OF MAXIM GORKY

Mark Donskoy, Soviet Union, 1938

#20 IVAN THE TERRIBLE, PART I

Sergei Eisenstein, Soviet Union, 1944

#21 THE CRANES ARE FLYING

Mikhail Kalatozov, Soviet Union, 1957

#22 IVAN THE TERRIBLE, PART II

Sergei Eisenstein, Soviet Union, 1958

#23 IVAN'S CHILDHOOD

Andrei Tarkovsky, Soviet Union, 1962

#24 I AM TWENTY

Marlen Khutsiev, Soviet Union, 1965

#25 SHADOWS OF FORGOTTEN ANCESTORS

Sergei Parajanov, Soviet Union, 1965

#26 WINGS

Larisa Shepitko, Soviet Union, 1966

#27 THE COMMISSAR

Aleksandr Askoldov, Soviet Union, 1967

#28 THE PLEA

Tengiz Abuladze, Soviet Union, 1967

#29 WAR AND PEACE

Sergei Bondarchuk, Soviet Union, 1967

#30 THE EVE OF IVAN KUPALO

Yuri Ilyenko, Soviet Union, 1968

#31 PIROSMANI

Giorgi Shengelaya, Soviet Union, 1969

#32 THE DEBUT

Gleb Panfilov, Soviet Union, 1970

#33 ONCE UPON A TIME THERE WAS A SINGING BLACKBIRD

Otar Iosseliani, Soviet Union, 1970

#34 KING LEAR

Grigori Kozintsev, Soviet Union, 1971

#35 THE LONG FAREWELL

Kira Muratova, Soviet Union, 1971

#36 SOLARIS

Andrei Tarkovsky, Soviet Union, 1972

#37 HEDGEHOG IN THE FOG

Yuri Norstein, Soviet Union, 1975

#38 SEASONS OF THE YEAR

Artavazd Peleshian, Soviet Union, 1975

#39 UNFINISHED PIECE FOR MECHANICAL PIANO

Nikita Mikhalkov, Soviet Union, 1977

#40 REPENTANCE

Tengiz Abuladze, Soviet Union, 1984

#41 MY FRIEND IVAN LAPSHIN

Aleksei German, Soviet Union, 1985

#42 JULY

Darezhan Omirbayev, Soviet Union, 1988

#43 FREEZE, DIE, COME TO LIFE

Vitali Kanevsky, Soviet Union, 1990

#44 MOTHER AND SON

Aleksandr Sokurov, Russia, 1997

#45 RUSSIAN ARK

Aleksandr Sokurov, Russia, 2002

#46 LEVIATHAN

Andrey Zvyagintsev, Russia, 2014

#47 BEANPOLE

Kantemir Balagov, Russia, 2019

#48 WET SAND

Elene Naveriani, Georgia, 2021

#49 THE NIGHT BEFORE CHRISTMAS

Wladyslaw Starewicz, Russia, 1913

#50 TWILIGHT OF A WOMAN'S SOUL

Yevgeni Bauer, Russia, 1913

#51 CHILD OF THE BIG CITY

Yevgeni Bauer, Russia, 1914

#52 DAYDREAMS

Yevgeni Bauer, Russia, 1915

#53 AELITA: QUEEN OF MARS

Yakov Protazanov, Soviet Union, 1924

#54 THE EXTRAORDINARY ADVENTURES OF MR. WEST IN THE LAND OF THE BOLSHEVIKS

#56 BY THE LAW

Lev Kuleshov, Soviet Union, 1926

#57 MOTHER

#58 THE OVERCOAT

Leonid Trauberg, Grigori Kozintsev, Soviet Union, 1926

#59 THE END OF ST. PETERSBURG

Vsevolod Pudovkin, Mikhail Doller, Soviet Union, 1927

#60 THE FALL OF THE ROMANOV DYNASTY

Esfir Shub, Soviet Union, 1927

#61 THE GIRL WITH THE HAT BOX

Boris Barnet, Soviet Union, 1927

#62 OCTOBER (TEN DAYS THAT SHOOK THE WORLD)

Sergei Eisenstein, Grigori Aleksandrov, Soviet Union, 1927

#63 CAUCASIAN LOVE

Nikoloz Shengelaia, Soviet Union, 1928

#64 THE ELEVENTH YEAR

Dziga Vertov, Soviet Union, 1928

#65 THE HOUSE ON TRUBNAYA SQUARE

#66 STORM OVER ASIA

#67 ZVENIGORA

#68 ARSENAL

#73 TURKSIB

Victor Turin, Soviet Union, 1929

#74 ENTHUSIASM

Dziga Vertov, Soviet Union, 1930

#75 SALT FOR SVANETIA

Mikhail Kalatozov, Soviet Union, 1930

#76 ROAD TO LIFE

Nikolai Ekk, Soviet Union, 1931

#77 IVAN

Aleksandr Dovzhenko, Soviet Union, 1932

#78 SONG OF HEROES

Joris Ivens, Soviet Union, 1932

#79 LAST CRUSADERS

Siko Dolidze, Soviet Union, 1933

#80 NIGHT ON BALD MOUNTAIN

Alexander Alexeieff, Claire Parker, France, 1933

#81 OUTSKIRTS

Boris Barnet, Soviet Union, 1933

#82 CHAPAYEV

Sergei Vasilyev, Georgi Vasilyev, Soviet Union, 1934

#83 JOLLY FELLOWS

Grigori Aleksandrov, Soviet Union, 1934

#84 THE NEW GULLIVER

Aleksandr Ptushko, A. Vanichkin, Soviet Union, 1935

#85 PEASANTS

Fridrikh Ermler, Soviet Union, 1935

#86 A SEVERE YOUNG MAN

Abram Room, Soviet Union, 1935

#87 THE YOUTH OF MAXIM

Leonid Trauberg, Grigori Kozintsev, Soviet Union, 1935

#88 CIRCUS

Grigori Aleksandrov, I. Simkov, Soviet Union, 1936

#89 VOLGA - VOLGA

Grigori Aleksandrov, Soviet Union, 1938

#90 MY APPRENTICESHIP

Mark Donskoy, Soviet Union, 1939

#91 MASHENKA

Yuli Raizman, Soviet Union, 1942

#92 MAGDANA'S DONKEY

Rezo Chkheidze, Tengiz Abuladze, Soviet Union, 1955

#93 CARNIVAL NIGHT

Eldar Ryazanov, Soviet Union, 1956

#94 THE FORTY-FIRST

Grigori Chukhrai, Soviet Union, 1956

#95 SPRING ON ZARECHNAYA STREET

Marlen Khutsiev, Feliks Mironer, Soviet Union, 1956

#96 THE WRESTLER AND THE CLOWN

Boris Barnet, Konstantin Yudin, Soviet Union, 1957

#97 POEM OF THE SEA

Yuliya Solntseva, Soviet Union, 1958

#98 BALLAD OF A SOLDIER

Grigori Chukhrai, Soviet Union, 1959

#99 DESTINY OF A MAN

Sergei Bondarchuk, Soviet Union, 1959

#100 THE LADY WITH THE LITTLE DOG

Iosif Kheifits, Soviet Union, 1960

Few days ago I ran into a list of the essential Soviet Union (and by extension, Russian) movies to watch. I don't think it's an actual top, though the first 10 movies in the list are spot-on. No external links, research and download them on your favorite websites.
